title: NixOS Package PRs for ksnip, NetworkManager-openvpn, nixos, nixos-build, nextcloud-client, vpnc-unstable-2021-11 packages
description: NixOS Package PRs for ksnip, NetworkManager-openvpn, nixos, nixos-build, nextcloud-client, vpnc-unstable-2021-11 packages on GitHub

items.content_html:
Description of changes

Some tests are unable to be run with 'nix build' due to the use of builtin.currentSystem. This PR fixes each instance of this and removes the default that uses this from make-test-python.nix. Marked as draft until CI confirms this

items.title: Nixos tests build discrepancy

items.content_html:
Description of changes

I keep getting deployer # Host key verification failed.
Currently seems to be the target host though, which used to work. A bit puzzling, but probably nothing too crazy, considering that I did change some of the original test setup.
cc @Enzime who authored the original setup for SSH to target. Was UserKnownHostsFile=/dev/null really necessary?

I'd really appreciate some help with this one.

items.title: [WIP] Test nixos-rebuild --build-host

items.content_html:
Description of changes

Currently the parsedmarc Module is not working. This is due to:

  1. elastic_transport not being available (Addressed by adding it to propagatedBuildInputs for elasticsearch)
  2. elasticsearch-dsl being pinned to a version no longer in nixpkgs (Addressed by unpinning; tests still pass)
  3. smtp.to having defaults causing evaluation errors.
  4. The default settings.elasticsearch.hosts (if elasticsearch is to be provisioned) not being a valid URL, causing errors.

items.title: nixos/parsedmarc: Fix build and runtime

items.content_html:
Description of changes

Building a NixOS disk image results in an error when compiled without Nix tooling, as indicated by the use of the option nix.enable = false;. Disabling Nix tools through this option not only deactivates general Nix tools but also deletes NixOS installer tools. Consequently, an error is encountered in the nixos/lib/make-disk-image.nix file due to the absence of the nixos-install component.

To address this issue, it is worth noting the availability of the system.disableInstallerTools option, which serves the purpose of disabling installer tools specifically. Therefore, adjusting the configuration by using nix.enable = false; should not interfere with the presence of NixOS installation tools, as this can be managed separately through system.disableInstallerTools.

Component:

nixos/installer/tools: remove nix tooling dependency from nixos config

Things done

items.title: nixos/installer: allow disk image build with `nix.enable=false;`

items.content_html:
Description of changes

With 23.11, nixos-containers won't build unless the option nixpkgs.hostPlatform is set.

Here's a minimal reproducible example:

{
  description = "nixos-containers bug demo";

  inputs.nixpkgs.url = "github:NixOS/nixpkgs/23.11";

  outputs = { self, nixpkgs }: {
    nixosModules.default = { pkgs, modulesPath, ... }: {
      containers.foo.config = {
        environment.systemPackages = [ pkgs.hello ];
        system.stateVersion = "22.05";
      };
      system.stateVersion = "22.05";
    };

    nixosConfigurations = {
      broken = nixpkgs.lib.nixosSystem rec {
        pkgs = nixpkgs.legacyPackages.x86_64-linux;
        modules = [
          "${nixpkgs}/nixos/modules/virtualisation/qemu-vm.nix"
          self.nixosModules.default
        ];
      };
    };
  };
}

This results in the following error:

‚ùØ nix flake check
error: Neither nixpkgs.hostPlatform nor the legacy option nixpkgs.system has been set.
       You can set nixpkgs.hostPlatform in hardware-configuration.nix by re-running
       a recent version of nixos-generate-config.
       The option nixpkgs.system is still fully supported for NixOS 22.05 interoperability,
       but will be deprecated in the future, so we recommend to set nixpkgs.hostPlatform.

This PR fixes the problem by using pkgs.stdenv instead of nixpkgs.system.

Things done

items.content_html:
Description of changes

This allows NixOS modules to take inputs as an extra argument. This may be useful for feeding version information into other config.

For example, I use this to inform a module which exposes a prometheus metric on the date of the nixpkgs version used to build the system (slightly abridged):

{ pkgs, config, inputs, ... }: {
  services.nginx.enable = true;
  services.nginx.virtualHosts."prometheus".root = pkgs.writeTextDir "/metrics" ''
    # HELP nixpkgs_date The timestamp of the last modification on the nixpkgs flake input used to build the system.
    # TYPE nixpkgs_date gauge
    nixpkgs_date ${toString inputs.nixpkgs.sourceInfo.lastModified}
  '';
}

This is mostly a convenience feature. Downstream flakes were already able to set specialArgs.inputs themselves, but this makes obtaining correct nixpkgs version information even in a flake which uses multiple different nixpkgs versions a little more elegant.

items.title: nixos/dnsproxy: init module

items.content_html:
Description of changes

create a module to use qbitTorrent as a service.

blocking issues

  • sufficient testing ( some testing is done, imo not enough.)
  • serverConfig
    • gendeepINI gets a fitting type to use for this option.
      qBittorrent from editing the config file if we want to define it ourselves.
    • qBittorrent.conf can be set as a symlink in the given location without being overwritten by the program. ( done with 1 sticky bit, this behaviour in qBittorrent of overwriting the path is annoying, but this deals with it well enough )
  • openFirewall
  • release notes entry ( currently unsure on formatting)

nice to haves

  • a better way to set CapabilityBoundingSet to restrict all.
  • an explanation for PrivateTmp being disabled upstream. ( qbittorrent/qBittorrent#6806 (comment) )
  • some way to generate the unique password format used.

notes

for service hardening I don't believe any of the following can be used simply because of the services purpose.
IPAddressDeny PrivateNetwork or restriction of AF_NETLINK AF_INET or AF_INET6 address families.
ProtectSystem cant be used without entirely declarative config

in my previous attempt at this here i was advised to simply make use of the service from the package, I'm unsure how to do this.
I started with an aim to follow https://github.com/qbittorrent/qBittorrent/blob/master/dist/unix/systemd/qbittorrent-nox%40.service.in I don't understand why it sets PrivateTmp to false however and have otherwise changed it significantly with service hardening and nix(os) specifics.

testing so far has been made following #279716

items.content_html:
Description of changes

Logiops is third-party software for configuring Logitech mice, e.g remapping buttons or scroll behavior. It is already packaged in nixpkgs, but there is no systemd service associated with it.

Closes #226575

Note: I'm not quite sure how to write tests for this service, so any help in that department would be much appreciated!

items.content_html:
Description of changes

Adds an option so that you can set the syncthing gui password from a file, ie, using sops-nix.

Similar to this PR which I only noticed afterwards #121811 and is related to some discussion here #85336.

Things done

I tested that with setting guiPasswordFile = "${config.sops.secrets."syncthing-gui-pw".path}"; and settings.gui.user="kim"; inside services.syncthing that I was asked prompted for credentials on launching the web gui and that it accepted the ones expected.

items.title: nixos/tests/consul: enable unfree

items.content_html:
Motivation for this change

All current dumps seem to do .pgp, e.g. https://keys.niif.hu/keydump/, http://stueve.us/keydump/.

Things done

    • macOS
    • other Linux distributions

  • Tested compilation of all pkgs that depend on this change using nix-shell -p nix-review --run "nix-review wip"
  • Tested execution of all binary files (usually in ./result/bin/)
  • Determined the impact on package closure size (by running nix path-info -S before and after)

Notify maintainers

cc @primeos @calbrecht @jcumming

items.content_html:
Fixes #62856

But to make it work I've chosen to extract system.build.fileSystems into separate option. Let me know if making with types; lazyAttrsOf unspecified is more favorable.

EDIT: this is now changed to attrsOf unspecified, due to manual present in system.build.

items.title: nixos/v2raya: add more options

items.content_html:
Description of changes

  • add inMemoryState

this causes tailscale to make the registration ephemeral. I use this for booting the nixos installer (which auto-runs sudo tailscale up --qr), and this ensures that the hostname get reused, instead of suffixed.

Also, it's just nice to not need to manually cleanup tailscale hosts from the admin panel, when I know some are going to be ephemeral by nature anyway.

definitely open to feedback about naming the option.

Things done

  • Built on platform(s)
    • x86_64-linux
    • aarch64-linux
    • x86_64-darwin

items.title: nixos/tailscale: add `state` option

items.content_html:
Description of changes

mautrix-discord has already been packaged, but as of yet no NixOS module has been provided. This is the same module that I've revived from #200462, but now with expanded hardening.
